From Wiktionary, the free dictionary

Catalan

[edit]

Etymology

[edit]

Borrowed from Latin cōnsōlārī.

Pronunciation

[edit]
  • IPA(key): (Central) [kun.suˈla]
  • IPA(key): (Balearic) [kon.soˈla]
  • IPA(key): (Valencia) [kon.soˈlaɾ]

Verb

[edit]

consolar (first-person singular present consolo, first-person singular preterite consolí, past participle consolat); root stress: (Central, Valencia, Balearic) /ɔ/

  1. (transitive) to console

Conjugation

[edit]
    Conjugation of consolar (first conjugation)
infinitive consolar
gerund consolant
past participle masculine feminine
singular consolat consolada
plural consolats consolades
person singular plural
first second third first second third
indicative jo tu ell/ella
vostè 		nosaltres
nós 		vosaltres
vós 		ells/elles
vostès
present consolo consoles consola consolem consoleu consolen
imperfect consolava consolaves consolava consolàvem consolàveu consolaven
future consolaré consolaràs consolarà consolarem consolareu consolaran
preterite consolí consolares consolà consolàrem consolàreu consolaren
conditional consolaria consolaries consolaria consolaríem consolaríeu consolarien
subjunctive jo tu ell/ella
vostè 		nosaltres
nós 		vosaltres
vós 		ells/elles
vostès
present consoli consolis consoli consolem consoleu consolin
imperfect consolés consolessis consolés consoléssim consoléssiu consolessin
imperative — tu vostè nosaltres vosaltres
vós 		vostès
affirmative — consola consoli consolem consoleu consolin
negative (no) — no consolis no consoli no consolem no consoleu no consolin

Related terms

[edit]
  • consol
  • consolació
  • consolador

Further reading

[edit]
  • “consolar”, in Diccionari de la llengua catalana [Dictionary of the Catalan Language] (in Catalan), second edition, Institute of Catalan Studies [Catalan: Institut d'Estudis Catalans], April 2007
  • “consolar”, in Gran Diccionari de la Llengua Catalana, Grup Enciclopèdia Catalana, 2025
  • “consolar” in Diccionari normatiu valencià, Acadèmia Valenciana de la Llengua.
  • “consolar” in Diccionari català-valencià-balear, Antoni Maria Alcover and Francesc de Borja Moll, 1962.

Galician

[edit]

Etymology

[edit]

Attested since circa 1300. Learned borrowing from Latin consōlāre, from cōnsōlor.

Pronunciation

[edit]
  • IPA(key): [konsoˈlaɾ]

Verb

[edit]

consolar (first-person singular present consolo, first-person singular preterite consolei, past participle consolado)

  1. (transitive) to console, to comfort

Conjugation

[edit]

(ti) 		Third-person

Related terms

[edit]
  • consolación
  • consolador
  • consolamento
  • consolo

References

[edit]
  • Seoane, Ernesto Xosé González; Granja, María Álvarez de la; Agrelo, Ana Isabel Boullón (2006–2022), “consolar”, in Dicionario de Dicionarios do galego medieval [Dictionary of dictionaries of Medieval Galician] (in Galician), Santiago de Compostela: Instituto da Lingua Galega
  • Barreiro, Xavier Varela; Guinovart, Xavier Gómez (2006–2018), “consol”, in Corpus Xelmírez: corpus lingüístico da Galicia medieval [Corpus Xelmírez: linguistic corpus of Medieval Galicia] (in Galician), Santiago de Compostela: Instituto da Lingua Galega
  • Antón Luís Santamarina Fernández, editor (2006–2013), “consolar”, in Dicionario de Dicionarios da lingua galega [Dictionary of Dictionaries of the Galician language] (in Galician), Santiago de Compostela: Instituto da Lingua Galega
  • Antón Luís Santamarina Fernández, Ernesto Xosé González Seoane, María Álvarez de la Granja, editors (2003–2018), “consolar”, in Tesouro informatizado da lingua galega (in Galician), Santiago de Compostela: Instituto da Lingua Galega

Further reading

[edit]
  • “consolar”, in Dicionario da Real Academia Galega (in Galician), A Coruña: Royal Galician Academy, 2012–2025
  • “consolar”, in Dicionário Estraviz de galego (in Galician), 2014–2025

Portuguese

[edit]

Etymology

[edit]

Borrowed from Latin cōnsōlāre, from cōnsōlor.

Pronunciation

[edit]
 
  • (Brazil) IPA(key): /kõ.soˈla(ʁ)/ [kõ.soˈla(h)]
  • (Brazil) IPA(key): /kõ.soˈla(ʁ)/ [kõ.soˈla(h)]
    • (São Paulo) IPA(key): /kõ.soˈla(ɾ)/
    • (Rio de Janeiro) IPA(key): /kõ.soˈla(ʁ)/ [kõ.soˈla(χ)]
    • (Southern Brazil) IPA(key): /kõ.soˈla(ɻ)/
 
  • (Portugal) IPA(key): /kõ.suˈlaɾ/
  • (Portugal) IPA(key): /kõ.suˈlaɾ/
    • (Southern Portugal) IPA(key): /kõ.suˈla.ɾi/

  • Homophone: consular (Portugal)
  • Hyphenation: con‧so‧lar

Verb

[edit]

consolar (first-person singular present consolo, first-person singular preterite consolei, past participle consolado)

  1. (transitive) to console, comfort

Conjugation

[edit]
    Conjugation of consolar (See Appendix:Portuguese verbs)

First-person
(eu) 		Second-person
(tu) 		Third-person
(ele / ela / você) 		First-person

Present consolo consolas consola consolamos consolais consolam
Imperfect consolava consolavas consolava consolávamos consoláveis consolavam
Preterite consolei consolaste consolou consolamos1, consolámos2 consolastes consolaram
Pluperfect consolara consolaras consolara consoláramos consoláreis consolaram
Future consolarei consolarás consolará consolaremos consolareis consolarão
Conditional consolaria consolarias consolaria consolaríamos consolaríeis consolariam
Subjunctive
Present console consoles console consolemos consoleis consolem
Imperfect consolasse consolasses consolasse consolássemos consolásseis consolassem

Imperative
Affirmative consola console consolemos consolai consolem
Negative (não) não consoles não console não consolemos não consoleis não consolem

1Brazilian Portuguese.
2European Portuguese.

Related terms

[edit]
  • consolação
  • consolador
  • consolo

Descendants

[edit]
  • Macanese: consolâ

Further reading

[edit]
  • “consolar” in Dicionário Aberto based on Novo Diccionário da Língua Portuguesa de Cândido de Figueiredo, 1913
  • “consolar”, in Dicionário Priberam da Língua Portuguesa (in Portuguese), Lisbon: Priberam, 2008–2025

Spanish

[edit]

Etymology

[edit]

From Latin cōnsōlārī.

Pronunciation

[edit]
  • IPA(key): /konsoˈlaɾ/ [kõn.soˈlaɾ]
  • Rhymes: -aɾ
  • Syllabification: con‧so‧lar

Verb

[edit]

consolar (first-person singular present consuelo, first-person singular preterite consolé, past participle consolado)

  1. (transitive) to console

Conjugation

[edit]
    Conjugation of consolar (o-ue alternation) (See Appendix:Spanish verbs)
infinitive consolar
gerund consolando
past participle masculine feminine
singular consolado consolada
plural consolados consoladas
singular plural
1st person 2nd person 3rd person 1st person 2nd person 3rd person
indicative yo tú
vos 		él/ella/ello
usted 		nosotros
nosotras 		vosotros
vosotras 		ellos/ellas
ustedes
present consuelo consuelastú
consolásvos 		consuela consolamos consoláis consuelan
imperfect consolaba consolabas consolaba consolábamos consolabais consolaban
preterite consolé consolaste consoló consolamos consolasteis consolaron
future consolaré consolarás consolará consolaremos consolaréis consolarán
conditional consolaría consolarías consolaría consolaríamos consolaríais consolarían
subjunctive yo tú
vos 		él/ella/ello
usted 		nosotros
nosotras 		vosotros
vosotras 		ellos/ellas
ustedes
present consuele consuelestú
consolésvos2 		consuele consolemos consoléis consuelen
imperfect
(ra) 		consolara consolaras consolara consoláramos consolarais consolaran
imperfect
(se) 		consolase consolases consolase consolásemos consolaseis consolasen
future1 consolare consolares consolare consoláremos consolareis consolaren
imperative — tú
vos 		usted nosotros
nosotras 		vosotros
vosotras 		ustedes
affirmative consuelatú
consolávos 		consuele consolemos consolad consuelen
negative no consueles no consuele no consolemos no consoléis no consuelen

1Mostly obsolete, now mainly used in legal language.
2Argentine and Uruguayan voseo prefers the tú form for the present subjunctive.

accusative consuélenme not used consuélenlo, consuélenla consuélennos not used consuélenlos, consuélenlas, consuélense
